Dear Mrs. Boyer:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on . Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action plan is
required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must
include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Rorie Dodge-Pifer at (517) 899-6024.
Sincerely,

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee records.
• (1) An institution shall maintain employee
records for each employee and shall include
documentation of all of the following information
prior to employment or at the time specified in
this rule:
• (e) Three dated references which are
obtained prior to employment from
persons unrelated to the employee and
which are less than 12 months old.

Two of five employees' files who have been employed less than a year lacked
three references prior to hire.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• There was no technical assistance requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation provided on CCI Rule 400.4113-1(c) regarding staff obtaining the
copy of the high school diploma or GED sign and date the back of the copy to
indicate when the verification was received in order to show the documentation
was obtained prior to hire.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 3 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
• 2024 Interim: Correction Action Plan was recorded during this reporting
period as a result of the Interim inspection completed on 3/8/2024. This
CAP contained rule violations of CCI Rule 400.4113(1)(j) Employee
records regarding an annual staff evaluation being late, CCI Rule
400.4155(2) Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; initial treatment plan regarding two of three youth files
reviewed lacking documented input from direct care staff and referral
source in the initial treatment plan, and CCI Rule 400.4156(2)
Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care institutions; updated
treatment plan regarding one of one youth files reviewed lacking
documented input from direct care staff and referral source in the
updated treatment plan. The facility submitted a CAP that was approved
on 3/22/2024 which contained action steps to ensure employee
evaluations were completed timely and documented input was entered
in intitial treatment plans and updated treatment plans. The CAP was
successful as there were no repeat violations found during the Renewal
inspection.

• Special Investigation 2024SIC0001618 with CAP approval date of
9/11/2024 was a result of a violation for Program Statement related to
professionalism. The agency provided training to the staff and
monitoring measures to ensure professionalism continues. The agency
is currently complying with the CAP action steps, and DCWL continues
to monitor CAP compliance with no noted concerns.
• Special Investigation 2025SIC0000275 with CAP approval date of
2/27/2025 was a result of violations regarding a restraint not being
warranted, the restraint not being conducted per the facilities restraint
model, staff pulling a youth on their body, a prone restraint occurring,
seclusion was used without the facility being allowed to seclude and
staff escalating an incident with a youth. The agency retrained staff,
implimented measures to ensure all restraints are reviewed, and
addressed the specific situation with the staff involved. The agency is
currently complying with the CAP action steps, and DCWL continues to
monitor CAP compliance with no noted concerns.
Financial Overview
The facilities financial audit was reviewed by Michigan Department of Health &
Human Services Bureau of Audit due to concerns noted in past audit findings. The
organization continues to have a decline in total net assets and a negative working
capital. There were repeated findings for the 2022 and 2023 audit. Corrective
measures will be requested and required to mitigate the finding by the Bureau of
Audit as the facility continues to not have staffing to complete the accounting
functions including segregation of duties. The facility’s corrective measures
indicated the Board of Directors would be involved in the day-to-day accounting
process so that one individual is not responsible for three transaction components,
authorization, custody, and recordkeeping. It appears that the Board of Directors
has not been involved in this process and the facility is not following their
corrective measures. The organization’s financial condition will continue to be
monitored.
Although there are continuing concerns regarding finances, this has not affected
the care of the youth at the facility.
PREA compliance
Agency completed their most recent PREA audit on 9/23/2024. The PREA audit
result was compliant. Agency will participate in another PREA audit in 2026.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator assessment was reviewed. Chief Administrator reported
since the last reporting period the facility has corrected the issues in the Interim

corrective action plan and identified no barriers to compliance which was able to
be verified as the facility did not have any repeat licensing violations.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Interviews with staff indicated the facility has continued to have difficulty filling
positions however recently started three new employees in training which will
significantly help with staffing. Staff reported feeling safe and supported at the
facility.
Youth interviews were conducted during onsite visits. The youth interviewed
reported feeling safe except when one peer is having difficulty, feeling respected,
and treated well by staff. All three youth reported no concerns with the facility and
that they enjoy being there.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An onsite inspection and walk through of the facility occurred on March 4, 2025.
There were no issues or safety concerns noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
